subject: History
title: The History of Blood Transfusion
description: A short lesson to help you apply The History of Blood Transfusion.

hook.text: Early blood transfusion attempts used lamb's blood. Predictably, most patients died horribly.

buildup.text: In 1667, Jean-Baptiste Denis transfused animal blood into humans. Some survived; others suffered fatal reactions.

discovery.text: Karl Landsteiner discovered blood types (A, B, O) in 1901â€”explaining why some transfusions killed.

twist.text: World War I created desperate demand. Doctors learned to store blood with sodium citrate, creating blood banks.

climax.text: Today, blood transfusions save 4.5 million lives annually. One discovery turned random death into routine rescue.

punchline.text: Knowing your type is the difference between life and death.

quiz.question: What discovery by Karl Landsteiner made safe blood transfusions possible?
options: That blood could be stored with anticoagulants
The existence of blood types A, B, and O
That animal blood could be safely used in humans
